intro: Rhytispermum villosum, commonly known as the hairy rhytispermum, is a flowering plant species native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are usually alternate and have a distinctive, often lobed shape. Rhytispermum villosum is primarily of interest in botanical studies due to its unique morphology and potential ecological roles.
